description: I love KDE Plasma but i have to unistall it because of this clipboard it's a mager SECURITY RISK
This is a huge security risk and I am unable to uninstall it!
please, it is dangerous, i dont want to

This should not exist. It defaults to saving the past few things copied in plaintext and it will persist across reboots. So if you were copying and pasting things from a password manager it would just keep them in a very easy to access place for God knows how long. That is so obviously terrible I amazed it is configured to behave like that by default. I don't remember if KDE has employees but if they do then someone needs to get fired.
summary: Reconfigure this immediately, the default config is awful

description:
To past some old copied item you need:
- "Open Klipper at Mouse Position" 
 (I set it to Ctrl+Shift+V)
- Use your keyboard arrows to navigate to the item
- Press Enter
- Press Ctrl+V

The last one action is redundant. After pressing Enter I expect that item will be past into focused/active text field like it is done in xfce4-clipman.

Please fix it or add option in Kclipper configuration to past selected item when enter is hit.
This "feature" is annoying at best, and is a real scurity problem. What is to stop someone from looking at the history after the user copy/pates a password, or worse?

summary: Cannot remove without deleting whole Plasma desktop

description: automatically copies anything you click on rendering it basically useless to replace text (e.g. to rename a file as you save it). Seems like it should be possible to limit actions to keyboard shortcuts only but nope, there is no way to turn of this "feature". Please please fix this basic plasma function
Unable to configure or remove, unlike all other plasma widgets. Stupid and a security risk.
It is very usefull for me
Probabbly the most buggy KDE app out there. I want it gone.

The idea behind this application is pretty nice. However had issues of "deselecting text" at each "ctrl+c" usage, and after too many unsuccessfull attempts to just disable it, I ended deleting "/etc/xde/autostart/klipper.desktop".
summary: May be usefull but hard to disable

description:
Security nightmare. When copy & pasting passwords, then the PW remains in the history by default, even after reboot.

Copy & paste is broken for the last two months or so. Content in the clip board is often not pastable using "Ctrl+Insert" or with right-click and click on "paste".
Can't remove it because it will remove half the system. Had to set history amount to 1 and uncheck "save on exit". Everyone already commented about security problems
for some reason Bitwarden is not able to delete copied passords after x seconds as set in the Bitwarden settings. You can find many reports on this issue on different forums as well.
Please remove this from the Plasma desktop defaults!
summary: why is this installed by default? SECURITY HAZARD!
